title: Paper Roll
text:
Inspired by some old shutters with worn, bent slats, Reiko Sudo tried numerous techniques to reference this quality in a contemporary fabric.  After developing several prototypes, NUNO found that working with narrow nylon ribbon sewn to a base cloth could create the desired effect.  With some research, connections were made with a cord embroidery company, which made manufacture of the design possible.  In 1997, using a water soluble base cloth, the fabric <I>Shutters<I> was produced. The same technique was again employed in 2002 for this fabric, when designers were inspired by rolled up papers as viewed in a spiraling cross-section.  

<I>Tsugihagi<I> on the North wall of this gallery was created with a similar technique.
description: red, very narrow tape interlaced in vertical circular patters in irregular sizes; very open weave
creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons and Rosa Lynn Pinkus
